result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:41 AM Defendant Cody R Homan in court with attorney Paul M Fredrickson. Prosecuting Atty Valerian Powell appeared for State of Wisconsin. Clerk quashed warrant.  Atty Fredrickson:  DE would still like to be screened for drug court.  Appear at Monday STC, but not following appt.  Then didn't appear at next hearing. CT: will not keep putting case off, will set trial dates, if he can complete screening and gets into drug court prior and wants to plea can do so, but has trial dates as back up. Court will inform parties if PTS is able to take him back.


Court heard back from PTS at 2:34 pm, and they will take Mr. Homan back.  

Court reissues $500 signature bonds with Pretrial services, random drug testing.  All other conditions remain as previously set.
Plea hearing on July 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:05 AM Defendant Cody R Homan in court with attorney Paul M Fredrickson. Prosecuting Atty Kyle Olsen appeared for State of Wisconsin.  State's argument for cash bail. Defense argument to reinstate previous bail, and not request further cash.   

Global offer was given.  Defense needs another two weeks for further discussions. Court will set for a drug court screening on monday, he will be released in the morning morning on a sig bond, in time to report to PTS, and then to his Drug Ct status conference. 

CT: orders a $500 signature bond EFFECTIVE Monday 5/23/22 at 8:00 am, with PTS, random drug testing. 
-DE to live with Eric Meyer at 506 Bowman Ave. All other conditions remain as previously set.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Paul M Fredrickson.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In court today for bail/bond hearing in cases 22CF97 and 19CF497. Atty Fredrickson gives argument. State gives argument. Court makes findings and reduces cash bail to $500.00 IN BOTH CASES. ALL OTHER BAIL CONDITIONS WILL REMAIN THE SAME.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.
